title: 35: soil carbon, Greek traditional seeds, starting a market garden and educators in Indiana
subtitle: 35: soil carbon, Greek traditional seeds, starting a market garden and educators in Indiana
summary: This month we begin in California, where they are paying farmers to sequester carbon, using practices proven to increase soil health. We head to the home of democracy to hear how Greek citizens are bringing seed saving back to the people. In Somerset we get some tips on starting a market garden and we end up back in the USA, this time deep in Indiana, to hear how one college is using the power of education to transform the landscape of the mid-west.
